lexUnit.name: wait.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stay where one is or delay action until a particular time or occurrence.

sentence.text: We had friends who waited two days in Sorata before getting transport to the Ancohuma base .
` Our fans have been waiting a long time for a game like Sunday 's .
Lucy waited patiently .
I wait patiently whilst he gives me the once-over .
Delaney patiently waited while the operator re-established the link .
Twenty or thirty thousand people were kneeling down facing westwards , patiently waiting for the final prayers of Ramadan .
After positioning the wad in my cheek I sat around waiting for the hit , feeling smug with my new-found anthropological skills .
And she was still there , waiting for me ! "
So we stayed where we were and waited with apprehension to see what would happen .
He waited with her for eight hours at the Northampton car park .
Two French ships were waiting at Montrose .
Some patients do not even get the chance of surgery because they have waited too long .
After all , in a way , he had waited most of his life to discover what could possibly be in the envelope he had now inherited .
Nicandra waited breathless for " Come in " to sound , before running to Maman 's bed for the first kiss of the day .
All sat down there waiting for a for a ship to come in .
He waited a very long time before saying , ` Talk , talk , talk , a man ca n't get a word in edgeways . "
Doctor Teesdale waited a little while , but no more sounds came from the receiver .
It has been well received and customers are having to wait two hours for a table on Saturday evenings .
For example Ms X was rehoused , after waiting 13 years for a transfer , from a notorious council estate to a comfortable semi-detached house just outside Southall .
Hammers are now waiting for a work permit for the 27-year-old , who won 18 caps for what was formerly Yugoslavia .
Now she was waiting for the food to reach her at the rapidly expanding camp .
She waited for a response , but Pascoe just nodded .
He waited while I soothed Bill .
